context: The word 'kaotad' is the second person singular present tense form of the verb 'kaotama', which means 'to lose'. It is used when addressing one person informally (you) and indicating an action that happens now or in the near future. The base form 'kaotama' can be conjugated to different tenses, persons, and numbers: kaotan (I lose), kaotad (you lose), kaotab (he/she/it loses), kaotame (we lose), kaotate (you plural lose), kaovad (they lose).
